sen.j: 三輪 子首（みわ の こびと、生年不明 - 天武天皇5年（676年）8月）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: MIWA no Kobito (year of birth unknown - September, 676) was a person who lived in the Asuka period of Japanese history.
MIWA no Kobito (year of birth unknown - August, 676 in old lunar calendar) was a person who lived in the Asuka period of Japanese history.
sen.cmt: 用語を統一します。他のこの時代の記事と同じく旧暦のままにして説明を加えます。
sen.e: MIWA no Kobito (year of birth unknown - August, 676 in old lunar calendar) was a person who lived in the Asuka period of Japanese history.

sen.j: 大三輪真上田子人（おおみわのまかむだのこびと）、あるいは神麻加牟陀児首（みわのまかむだのこびと）ともいう。
sen.e: He was also known as OMIWA no Makamuda no Kobito or MIWA no Makamuda no Kobito.
He was also known as OMIWA no Makamuda no Kobito or MIWA no Makamuda no Kobito.
He was also known as OMIWA no Makamuda no Kobito or MIWA no Makamuda no Kobito.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: His name is pronounced the same way in old Japanese syllabary characters.
His name is pronounced the same way in old Japanese syllabary characters.
His name is pronounced the same way in old Japanese syllabary characters.

sen.j: 死後に大三輪真上田迎（おおみわのまかむだのむかえ）と諡され、旧仮名遣いでは「むかえ」が「むかへ」となる。
sen.e: He was posthumously named OMIWA no Makamuda no Mukae, and 'Mukae' (むかえ)is written 'Mukahe' (むかへ) in old Japanese syllabary characters.
sen.cmt: 「むかえ」「むかへ」→訳文に日本語表記も入れました。
sen.e: He was posthumously named OMIWA no Makamuda no Mukae, and it is considered that Mukae had been pronounced as Mukafe according to the old Japanese syllabary characters.
sen.cmt: 飛鳥時代、は行は「f」で発音されていたので「mukafe」となります。オリジナル著者がこの説明を加えているのは発音が異なることを示すためです。「旧仮名遣いでは」という言い方はおかしくてこの著者以外使わないと思われますが、正しく訳すと左のようになります。
sen.e: He was posthumously named OMIWA no Makamuda no Mukae, and it is considered that Mukae had been pronounced as Mukafe according to the old Japanese syllabary characters.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は君。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Kimi.
sen.cmt: 君→括弧内に姓の説明があるので、”君”はそのままローマ字表記としました。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Kimi.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Kimi.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき、伊勢国で大海人皇子（天武天皇）を迎え、後に大和国への増援軍の指揮官の一人になった。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, he received Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in Ise Province, and later became one of commanders of reinforcements for Yamato Province.
In the Jinshin War in 672, he received Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in Ise Province, and later became one of commanders of reinforcements for Yamato Province.
In the Jinshin War in 672, he received Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in Ise Province, and later became one of commanders of reinforcements for Yamato Province.

sen.j: 壬申の乱の勃発時、三輪子首は伊勢国の介であったと推測されている。
sen.e: It is thought that MIWA no Kobito was Ise no kuni no suke (Assistant Governor of Ise Province) when the Jinshin War broke out.
It is thought that MIWA no Kobito was Ise no kuni no suke (Assistant Governor of Ise Province) when the Jinshin War broke out.

sen.j: 大海人皇子はまず美濃国で兵を集めさせ、自らは6月24日に大和国の吉野宮を発って東に向かった。
sen.e: Prince Oama firstly gathered troops in Mino Province, and he himself left Yoshino no miya Palace in Yamato Province for the east on July 27.
sen.cmt: 24日→ここまで一度も月日についての記載がないので、月をウェブから補い、原文・訳文に追記しました（旧暦6月24日→新暦7月27日）吉野宮→Yoshino no miya Palace と訳しました。
sen.e: Prince Oama firstly ordered to gather troops in Mino Province, and Oama himself left Yoshino no miya (Yoshino Palace) of Yamato Province for the east on June 24 (in old lunar calendar).
Prince Oama firstly ordered to gather troops in Mino Province, and Oama himself left Yoshino no miya (Yoshino Palace) of Yamato Province for the east on June 24 (in old lunar calendar).

sen.j: 25日に伊勢の鈴鹿郡に入ったところ、国司守の三宅石床、介の三輪子首、湯沐令の田中足麻呂、高田新家に出会った。
sen.e: When he arrived in Suzuka County, Ise Province, on 28th, he met MIYAKE no Iwatoko, who was kokushi, kami (provincial governor), MIWA no Kobito, who was kokushi, suke (assistant provincial governor), TANAKA no Tarimaro, who was Yunonagashi (manager of imperial territories), and TAKATA no Ninomi.
sen.cmt: 介三輪子首→”国司”を補い、”国司介三輪君子首”と訳しました。湯沐令→Yunonagashi (manager of imperial territories)と訳しました（定訳不明）湯沐令は田中足麻呂として訳し、高田新家の役職は未記載と解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: On 25th he arrived in Suzuka County of Ise Province, and met Kuninomikotomochi-no-kami (provincial governor) MIYAKE no Iwatoko, Suke (assistant provincial governor) MIWA no Kobito, Yu-no-unagashi (manager of Yu [imperial territories]) TANAKA no Tarimaro, and TAKATA no Niinomi.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違いがあります。「国司守」は「くにのみこともちのかみ」、「湯沐令」は「ゆのうながし」、「新家」はもともと「にひのみNifinomi」なので「にいのみNiinomi」となります。
sen.e: On 25th he arrived in Suzuka County of Ise Province, and met Kuninomikotomochi-no-kami (provincial governor) MIYAKE no Iwatoko, Suke (assistant provincial governor) MIWA no Kobito, Yu-no-unagashi (manager of Yu [imperial territories]) TANAKA no Tarimaro, and TAKATA no Niinomi.

sen.j: そこで500人の兵を発して、鈴鹿山道を封鎖した。
sen.e: There he deployed 500 soldiers to block Suzuka mountain pass.
sen.cmt: 鈴鹿山道→Suzuka mountain pass と訳しました。
sen.e: There he deployed 500 soldiers to block Suzuka mountain pass.
There he deployed 500 soldiers to block Suzuka mountain pass.

sen.j: 以上が『日本書紀』の説明で、500人の兵は三宅が連れてきたものと推測される。
sen.e: The above story is described in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), and it is thought that the 500 soldiers were brought by Miyake.

sen.j: この後も伊勢国からは兵力が動員され、軍の一翼を担ったと考えられる。
sen.e: It is thought that troops were mobilized from Ise Province also after then and played a role in the army.
It is thought that troops were mobilized from Ise Province also after then and played a role in the army.
It is thought that troops were mobilized from Ise Province also after then and played a role in the army.

sen.j: 子首はこの後、7月2日に美濃から倭（大和国）に向かう軍の指揮官になった。
sen.e: Subsequently, on August 3, Kobito became a commander of an army heading from Mino Province to Wa (Yamato Province).
Subsequently, on July 2 (in old lunar calendar), Kobito became a commander of an army heading from Mino Province to Yamato (Yamato Province).
sen.cmt: 「倭」は「やまと」という地名です。
sen.e: Subsequently, on July 2 (in old lunar calendar), Kobito became a commander of an army heading from Mino Province to Yamato (Yamato Province).

sen.j: 共に軍を率いたのは、紀阿閉麻呂、多品治、置始菟であった。
sen.e: Those who led the army together were KI no Ahemaro, O no Honji and OKISOME no Usagi.
Those who led the army together were KI no Ahemaro, O no Honji and OKISOME no Usagi.
Those who led the army together were KI no Ahemaro, O no Honji and OKISOME no Usagi.

sen.j: 倭に到着してから大伴吹負のもとで戦ったが、そこでの子首の行動については書紀に記載がない。
sen.e: After arriving in Wa, they fought under OTOMO no Fukei; however, Nihonshoki does not describe anything about Kobito's actions there.
sen.cmt: 書紀→Nihonshoki と訳しました。
sen.e: After arriving in Yamato, they fought under OTOMO no Fukei; however, Nihonshoki does not describe anything about Kobito's actions there.
After arriving in Yamato, they fought under OTOMO no Fukei; however, Nihonshoki does not describe anything about Kobito's actions there.

sen.j: 『続日本紀』大宝 (日本)元年（701年）6月11日条によって、神麻加牟陀君児首が100戸を封じられたことが知られる。
sen.e: From the article of July 14, 701 in "Shoku Nihongi"(Chronicle of Japan Continued), it is known that MIWA no Makamuda no Kimi Kobito was allotted 100 vassal households.
sen.cmt: 神麻加牟陀君児首→MIWA no Makamuda no Kimi Kobito と訳しました。
sen.e: From the article of June 11, 701 (in old lunar calendar) of "Shoku Nihongi"(Chronicle of Japan Continued), it is known that MIWA no Makamuda no Kimi no Kobito was allotted 100 vassal households.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。書物の記事の月日は参照のためそのまま記すべきですので説明を加えて直します。
sen.e: From the article of June 11, 701 (in old lunar calendar) of "Shoku Nihongi"(Chronicle of Japan Continued), it is known that MIWA no Makamuda no Kimi no Kobito was allotted 100 vassal households.

sen.j: 天武天皇5年（676年）8月に大三輪真上田子人君が死んだ。
sen.e: In September in 676, OMIWA no Makamuda no Kobito no Kimi died.
sen.cmt: 8月→9月か10月となりますが、9月で訳しました。大三輪真上田子人君→OMIWA no Makamuda no Kobito no Kimi と訳しました。
sen.e: In August, 676 (in old lunar calendar), OMIWA no Makamuda no Kobito no Kimi died.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: In August, 676 (in old lunar calendar), OMIWA no Makamuda no Kobito no Kimi died.

sen.j: 天皇はこれを聞いて大いに悲しみ、壬申の年の功によって、内小紫の位を贈り、大三輪真上田迎君と諡した。
sen.e: The Emperor felt so sad to hear this news, and awarded him Uchi no shoshi (内小紫) (a kind of cap rank) for his distinguished services in the year of Jinshin (Mizunoe-Saru [one of the Oriental Zodiac]), as well as giving him posthumous name of OMIWA no Makamuda no Mukae no Kimi.
sen.cmt: 内小紫→Uchi no shosi (a kind of cap rank) ［正しい読み方が不明です］ ("内小紫位"は用語登録有り）壬申の年→壬申という言葉を残し、the year of Jinshin (Mizunoe-Saru [one of the Oriental Zodiac]) と訳しました（括弧内の訳は用語登録有り）
sen.e: Hearing the news, the Emperor mourned over the loss, and raised his rank to Uchinoshoshi for his distinguished services in the year of Jinshin, and gave him the posthumous name of OMIWA no Makamuda no Mukae no Kimi.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。「内小紫」は「うちのしょうし」で大丈夫です。
sen.e: Hearing the news, the Emperor mourned over the loss, and raised his rank to Uchinoshoshi for his distinguished services in the year of Jinshin, and gave him the posthumous name of OMIWA no Makamuda no Mukae no Kimi.

sen.j: 迎とは、大海人皇子を鈴鹿で迎えたことによる。
sen.e: "Mukae"(means "to welcome" in Japanese) is derived from the fact that he received Prince Oama in Suzuka.
sen.cmt: 迎→括弧内に意味を補足しました。
sen.e: Mukae' (means 'to welcome' in Japanese) was derived from the fact that he had received Prince Oama in Suzuka.

tit.e: Ise no suke (assistant governor of Ise Province) or Mino no suke (assistant governor of Mino Province)

sen.j: 出迎えについて記すところで、『日本書紀』は「国司守三宅連石床、介三輪君子首」とだけ記し、どの国の国司だったかを伝えない。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" only states 'MIYAKE no Muraji Iwatoko, who was kokushi, kami (provincial governor), MIWA no Kimi Kobito, who was kokushi, suke (assistant provincial governor)' in the scene that he received Prince Oama, and it does not mention of which province he was kokushi (provincial governor).
sen.cmt: 出迎え→”大海人皇子の”出迎え、と補足して訳しました。介三輪君子首→”国司”を補い、”国司介三輪君子首”と訳しました。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" only states 'Kuninomikonomochi-no-kami (provincial governor) MIYAKE no Muraji Iwatoko and Suke (assistant provincial governor) MIWA no Kimi Kobito' in the scene of receiving Prince Oama, and does not mention about which province's governor he was.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違い、文法ミスがあります。書物の引用部分は原文に近いかたちにしたほうがずっとわかりやすいです。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" only states 'Kuninomikonomochi-no-kami (provincial governor) MIYAKE no Muraji Iwatoko and Suke (assistant provincial governor) MIWA no Kimi Kobito' in the scene of receiving Prince Oama, and does not mention about which province's governor he was.

sen.j: 場所が伊勢国なので伊勢の国司とするのが自然な文脈解釈である。
sen.e: It is contextually natural to understand that he was kokushi of Ise Province, since it was the scene in Ise Province.
It is contextually natural to understand that he was governor of Ise Province, since it was the scene in Ise Province.
It is contextually natural to understand that he was governor of Ise Province, since it was the scene in Ise Province.

sen.j: 時代が下って『日本三代実録』の仁和3年（887年）3月1日条、子首の孫の孫にあたる大神良臣の訴えの中では、三輪君子首を伊勢介とする。
sen.e: Later, in the article of April 2, 887 in "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (sixth of the six classical Japanese history texts), which describes a complaint of OMIWA no Yoshiomi, a grandchild of Kobito's grandchild, MIWA no Kimi Kobito was referred to as Ise no suke.
sen.cmt: 仁和3年→用語登録には”仁和3年in :885 ”と登録されているものがありますが、887年で訳しました。
sen.e: According to the article of March 1, 887 (in old lunar calendar) of "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (Chronicles of the three Emperors of Japan) which describes a complaint from OMIWA no Yoshiomi, a grandchild of Kobito's grandchild, MIWA no Kimi Kobito was referred to as Ise no Suke.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス、訳語選択ミスがあります。『三代実録』を「six…」とするのは六国史の中の位置づけであって訳ではありません。西暦について、翻訳者の指摘どおりオリジナルが正確で、登録単語は間違いです。

sen.j: これは、ともに出迎えた高田新家が美濃国の主稲という役人だったことを示す記事が『続日本紀』にあることによる。
sen.e: This is based on the article in "Shoku Nihongi" indicating that TAKATA no Ninomi, who received Prince Oama with Kobito, was 主稲 (a government officer) of Mino Province.
